2013: Secure Access</titl>         <altTitl>VS</altTitl>         <IDNo agency="UKDA">7421</IDNo>         <IDNo agency="datacite">10.5255/UKDA-SN-7421-1</IDNo>       </titlStmt>       <rspStmt> Queen's Printer for Scotland</copyright>         <fundAg>Office for National Statistics</fundAg>       </prodStmt>       <distStmt>         <distrbtr>UK Data Service</distrbtr>         <depositr>Office for National Statistics</depositr>         <depDate date="2013-11-19T00:00:00Z">19 November 2013</depDate>         <distDate date="2014-10-01T00:00:00Z">1 October 2014</distDate>       </distStmt>       <verStmt>         <version date="2014-10-01T00:00:00Z">1</version>       </verStmt>       <holdings URI="http://dx.doi.org/10.5255/UKDA-SN-7421-1" />     </citation>     <stdyInfo>       <subject>         <keyword>2013</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/8bbecbfd-57cf-497f-b4ac-b24833adb6de">EMPLOYEES</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/e7629f9a-6db1-493b-8c7c-34ce3f789e4d">EMPLOYERS</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/93785cf4-23d1-4d38-84a3-375fa66223d5">EMPLOYMENT</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/a88887cd-0807-4b8e-aa66-045bea330bc5">GREAT BRITAIN</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/24ce0e84-e80b-497d-8f34-8bed51d4ab5a">INDUSTRIES</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/4c3cca54-d325-44d2-a426-04fb88084e1a">JOB VACANCIES</keyword>         <keyword vocabURI="http://lod.data-archive.ac.uk/skoshasset/24d24247-8279-4378-a16f-c3bee41273b6">RECRUITMENT</keyword>         <topcClas>Economic conditions and indicators - Economics</topcClas>         <topcClas>General - Employment and labour</topcClas>         <topcClas>Management and organisation - Industry and management</topcClas>       </subject>       <abstract><p>Abstract copyright UK Data Service and data collection copyright owner.</p>The <i>Vacancy Survey</i> (VS) is a statutory, monthly survey of businesses in Great Britain, which asks the single question, how many job vacancies did a business have in total on a specified date for which they were actively seeking recruits from outside their organisation.  Vacancy statistics provide important information about the demand for labour, and give an early indication of what is happening in the labour market. They are used for monitoring and policy-making purposes by UK government departments and Eurostat.<br> <br> Questionnaires are sent to a sample of approximately 6,000 businesses on the Inter-Departmental Business Register (IDBR) every month, approached mainly via head offices rather than by local offices. The IDBR is a live register of data on businesses collected by HM Revenue and Customs via VAT and Pay As You Earn (PAYE) records.  Businesses return their <i>Vacancy Survey</i> data to the Office for National Statistics using key presses on a telephone rather than returning a paper questionnaire. A small number of businesses have elected to receive a paper questionnaire which is returned in the pre-paid envelope provided.<br> <br> The survey covers all sectors of the economy, with the exception of employment agencies and agriculture, forestry and fishing.<br> <br> <i>Linking to other business studies</i><br> These data contain IDBR reference numbers. These are anonymous but unique reference numbers assigned to business organisations. Their inclusion allows researchers to combine different business survey sources together. Researchers may consider applying for other business data to assist their research.<br> <br/></abstract>       <abstract><B>Main Topics</B>:<br>The <i>Vacancy Survey</i> data files held under SN 7421 include the following information for each business surveyed each month:<ul><li>returned or imputed number of vacancies</li><li>number of employees, from the IDBR</li><li>Standard Industrial Classification code</li><li>design, calibration and outlier weights</li><li>IDBR reporting unit reference number</li></ul></abstract>       <sumDscr>         <timePrd event="start" date="2013-02-01T00:00:00Z">01 February 2013</timePrd>         <timePrd event="end" date="2013-09-01T00:00:00Z">01 September 2013</timePrd>         <nation>Great Britain</nation>         <geogUnit>No spatial unit</geogUnit>         <anlyUnit>Institutions/organisations</anlyUnit>         <universe>National</universe>         <universe>Businesses in Great Britain registered for VAT and/or PAYE in 2013.</universe>         <dataKind>Alpha/numeric data</dataKind>         <dataKind> Individual (micro) level</dataKind>       </sumDscr>     </stdyInfo>     <method>       <dataColl>         <timeMeth>Repeated cross-sectional study</timeMeth>         <sampProc>Stratified random sample with 100 per cent coverage of businesses with employment (as recorded on the IDBR) above a threshold that varies by industry.</sampProc>         <deviat>Approximately 6,000 businesses each month</deviat>         <collMode>Automated Telephone Data Entry system (TDE). Businesses return data to ONS using key presses on a telephone</collMode>         <sources />         <weight>Weighting used. See documentation for details</weight>         <cleanOps>A</cleanOps>       </dataColl>     </method>     <dataAccs>       <setAvail>         <accsPlac>UK Data Service</accsPlac>       </setAvail>       <useStmt>         <specPerm>Secure data</specPerm>         <restrctn>Registration is required and standard conditions of use apply. The depositor may be informed about usage. Controlled data requirements and conditions also apply. Further information is available from <a href='http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/get-data/how-to-access/accesssecurelab.aspx'>Access to the Secure Lab</a>. In addition, the Service is required to request explicit permission from the data owner prior to providing the researcher with access to the data.<br> Available to UK HE/FE applicants only. <p>Please note:<br>Since these data are more sensitive and/or pose a higher risk of disclosure than data made available under the standard End User Licence or under a Special Licence, they are not available for download but may be accessed through Secure Access. Access requires accreditation by the UK Statistics Authority as an Approved Researcher, completion of face-to-face training, and agreement to the Secure Access's <a href='http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/media/176858/ukda140_sds_sdsagreement_public.pdf'>User Agreement</a> and <a href='http://ukdataservice.ac.uk/media/176861/UKDA142_SDS_SecurityBreaches_public.pdf'>Breaches Penalties Policy</a>. This is to ensure that the guarantee of confidentiality given to survey respondents is protected. Applications are screened by the UK Data Archive and the Office for National Statistics, and access is only granted to those researchers requiring data for statistical research purposes and who can justify their need for the data. Users who obtain access to these data are required to read and follow the <a href='http://www.data-archive.ac.uk/media/132701/UKDA171-SS-MicrodataHandling.pdf'> Microdata Handling and Security: Guide to Good Practice</a>.</restrctn>         <contact><a href=http://www.ukdataservice.ac.uk/help/get-in-touch.aspx>Get in touch</a></contact>       </useStmt>     </dataAccs>     <othrStdyMat>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <relPubl>   </relPubl>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Description: English</othRefs>       <othRefs>Language Of Study Documentation: English</othRefs>     </othrStdyMat>   </stdyDscr> </codeBook>
